abstract.p: Partial list of church and civic leaders expected to attend funeral of Cardinal John O'Connor (S)

block.p: Following is a partial list of church and civic leaders expected to attend the funeral of Cardinal John O'Connor at 2 p.m. today, according to officials of the New York Archdiocese:

Angelo Sodano, Vatican secretary of state Luis Aponte Martinez, archbishop emeritus of San Juan, P.R. William Baum, archbishop in the Roman Curia Anthony Bevilacqua, Philadelphia Cahal Daly, Ireland Francis George, Chicago James Hickey, Washington William Keeler, Baltimore Bernard Law, Boston Nicolas Lopez Rodriguez, Santo Domingo Roger Mahony, Los Angeles Adam Maida, Detroit Jaime Ortega y Alamino, Havana Norberto Rivera Carrera, Mexico City Edmund Szoka, president of the Pontifical Commission for Vatican City State
Following is a partial list of church and civic leaders expected to attend the funeral of Cardinal John O'Connor at 2 p.m. today, according to officials of the New York Archdiocese:

Angelo Sodano, Vatican secretary of state Luis Aponte Martinez, archbishop emeritus of San Juan, P.R. William Baum, archbishop in the Roman Curia Anthony Bevilacqua, Philadelphia Cahal Daly, Ireland Francis George, Chicago James Hickey, Washington William Keeler, Baltimore Bernard Law, Boston Nicolas Lopez Rodriguez, Santo Domingo Roger Mahony, Los Angeles Adam Maida, Detroit Jaime Ortega y Alamino, Havana Norberto Rivera Carrera, Mexico City Edmund Szoka, president of the Pontifical Commission for Vatican City State

Sean Brady Daniel M. Buechlein Daniel Cronin John Favalora Harry J. Flynn John P. Foley Peter Gerety Roberto Gonzalez William Levada Theodore McCarrick Edwin O'Brien Cormac Murphy-O'Connor Justin Rigali Stephen Sulyk John Vlazny

Metropolitan Theodosius, Orthodox Church in America Archbishop Demetrios, Greek Orthodox Archdiocese of America Archbishop Iakovos, Greek Orthodox Archdiocese of America Bishop Mercurius of Zaraisk, Orthodox Patriarchate of Moscow Father Boris Komaishko, Orthodox Patriarchate of Moscow Archbishop Khajag Barsamian, Armenian Apostolic Church Archbishop Oshagan Choloyan, Armenian Prelacy Archbishop Mor Kyrillos Karem, Syrian Orthodox Church Chorbishop John Meno, Syrian Orthodox Church Archbishop Zachariah Mar Nicholovos, Syrian Orthodox Church Archbishop Matthias, Ethiopian Orthodox Church Bishop Richard Grein, Episcopal Diocese of New York Bishop Stephen Bouman, Evangelical Lutheran Church

CIVIC LEADERS President Clinton Vice President Al Gore Mayor Rudolph W. Giuliani Former President George Bush Gov. George W. Bush Kofi Annan, United Nations secretary general Madeleine K. Albright, secretary of state Andrew M. Cuomo, secretary of housing and urban development Senator Daniel Patrick Moynihan Former Senator Alfonse M. D'Amato
